title: How to Install a Drip Irrigation System

tasks.task: Converting a sprinkler system into a drip irrigation system on a garden bed
subtasks: Closing off all sprinklers in the station to be converted
Removing sprinkler heads and replacing them with caps
Attaching an elbow and adapter to the remaining sprinkler head
Installing backbones tubing (half-inch blank irrigation tubing) using a T-adapter and elbows
Cutting and inserting emitter tubing (with emitters every 12 inches) into the backbone tubing
Staggering emitters between lines for even coverage
Pinning tubing in place with ground staples to keep it in position
Installing a filter at the valve connection to prevent clogging
Connecting the final lines and flushing the system to remove debris
